home.textOne: I'm Mia Salazar, a Front-end developer and cookie monster.
home.textTwo: In 2018, I started in computer science and have been in love with it ever since. Currently, I'm specializing in accessibility, a topic that I'm passionate about. I'm a curious person who enjoys diving into challenges and always learning something new.
home.textThree: Naturally geeky, when I'm not coding in my free time, I watch series, play board games or role-playing games, or go to the movies.
home.textFour: I love developing products that focus on accessibility and people. Although I currently work as a Front-end developer and am passionate about Frame, I also enjoy back-end development.
home.textFive: Here you can see some of the technologies I've worked with.

activities.text: In addition to being a cookie monster, I am a person who loves to get into trouble and look for new activities. Here you can see all the challenges I've gotten into: from talks to Game Jams.

contact.text: If you have something to tell me or an interesting challenge, don't hesitate to write to me!
contact.name: Name
contact.comment: What do you want to tell me?

portfolio.text: Here you can see some of the projects I've worked on professionally, and many of the personal projects I've done.
portfolio.textTwo: Before being a cookie monster, I was an intergalactic traveler and a superheroine. You can see my projects here.

articles.text: Disfruto mucho escribiendo artículos sobre diversos temas. Mi favorito es la accesibilidad, pero también escribo sobre front-end, programación y soft skills.
articles.textTwo: Here you can check all my articles.
